intro: Tetracera billardierei, commonly known as the golden rain tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy blooms and adaptability to various soil types. Tetracera billardierei prefers full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
